meanings.definition: Large or heavy and therefore difficult to carry or use
meanings.sent1: The big, heavy backpack was so cumbersome that I could barely lift it.
meanings.sent2: Moving the bulky furniture up the stairs was a cumbersome task.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those books in my arms was quite a cumbersome sight!
meanings.sent4: The cumbersome weight of responsibility pressed down on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The cumbersome rock blocked the path, making it impossible to pass.

meanings.definition: Complicated and inefficient, causing difficulty or delay
meanings.sent1: The complex and confusing instructions were so cumbersome that I couldn't follow them.
meanings.sent2: The old computer system was slow and cumbersome to use.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all those tasks at once felt like a cumbersome circus act.
meanings.sent4: The cumbersome bureaucracy slowed down the entire process.
meanings.sent5: Her cumbersome explanations only added to the confusion.
